page.title: 07Place names
page.content: Throughout the Cock Clarks/Purleigh area we found many examples of place names with interesting backgrounds or historical connotations. {Cock Clarks}itself was originally Cock Larks taking this name from the number of birds in the area. {Squeaking-gate Wood}presumably is derived such a gate though we found none. {Tatty-bugle Farm}takes its name from the Scottish for a scarecrow. Many house names tell historical stories;{Colony House}stands on the site of the old Russian colony,{Quanah is named after the first Red Indian Christian who came to England,{ {Purleigh Herd}is so called because there was once a herd of pigs kept here.
